title: Mutual fund flows have brought a lot of resilience to Indian markets: SEBI
text:
2 Min Read
Securities Exchange Board of India (SEBI) Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch on Friday (January 10) highlighted how mutual fund flows have played a crucial role in enhancing the resilience of India's financial markets.
“The growth of mutual funds in our country is very strong,” she said while speaking at NSE's Samvad Symposium.
Buch highlighted the sector's strong governance and disclosure practices that are benefiting more citizens in wealth creation.
The industry’s growth is reflected in its numbers too.

Over the past five years, AUM has more than doubled from ₹26.54 lakh crore in 2019, according to latest Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data.
The mutual fund industry crossed the milestone of 10 crore folios in May 2021, and by December 2024, the number of folios had surged to 22.5 crore.
As of December 2024, 17.9 crore folios were recorded in equity, hybrid, and solution-oriented schemes—where the bulk of retail investments are concentrated.
This shift reflects a growing inclination among retail investors to commit to long-term wealth-building strategies.
Buch also pointed out the growing significance of mutual funds in stabilising the markets, noting that the inflow of retail investments has been a key factor in fortifying the Indian financial system.
She acknowledged the role of Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) in broadening the investor base.
